alert.note: Alert for Kimble; Mason (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 19 at 8:58PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Kimble, southeastern Menard and Mason Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 858 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Long Mountain, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mason, Art, Pontotoc, Loyal Valley, Fredonia, Saline, Streeter, Hedwigs Hill, Camp Air, Hilda, Long Mountain, Grit, Katemcy, London, Hext, The Intersection Of Us-83 And Ranch Road 1773, Erna, Us- 377 Near The Kimble- Menard County Line, The Intersection Of Highway 29 And Ranch Road 1222 and Us-87 Near The Mason-Gillespie County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for west central Texas.
